result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Chad Nicholas Meier was found guilty of Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Chad Nicholas Meier was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Huber release privileges for work.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation;  nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
*Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job.

*No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
*No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
*No alcohol or controlled substances.

*AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: *Court ordered defendant pay a forfeiture in the amount of $350.00 PLUS Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments payable during term of probation on COUNT 1.
*Huber release privileges for work and child care.  Court allows release 6 days a week, 12 hours per day.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on October 30, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Nicholas Meier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order for Funeral Pass signed and filed. The defendant's petition is GRANTED. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Chad Nicholas Meier in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work, consecutive to any other sentence.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions:
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation;  nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 105 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work and child care.  Court allows release 6 days a week, 12 hours per day.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on October 30, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.
-Court ordered defendant pay a forfeiture in the amount of $350.00 PLUS Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments payable during term of probation on COUNT 1.
-Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 1 year
-Court ordered ignition interlock for 1 year

Defendant Chad Nicholas Meier in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 DISMISSED.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST to COUNTS 1 and 2  and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgement of Conviction be entered into the record.  Matter adjourned for Sentencing.

Defendant Chad Nicholas Meier in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Amended Information received and filed.  Charges amended to:  COUNT 1:  Fleeing pursuant to Wisc. Stats 346.02(2t), 346.17 (2) a Class A Misdemeanor

Defendant Chad Nicholas Meier in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has a pending matter in Waukesha that needs to be resolved before this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad Nicholas Meier in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Parties may have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad Nicholas Meier in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Negotations are on-going.  Parties request another status date.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad Nicholas Meier in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Megan Carmody for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense needs additional time to review offer with the defendant; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad Nicholas Meier in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Megan Williamson for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 2553 North 63rd Street, Wauwatosa, WI 53213

As an additional condition of bail:
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No drugs without a valid prescription
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Chad Nicholas Meier in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-076

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  

As to Counts 2 and 3:
Defense counsel entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
